qas.question: Is the environmental performance of CFLs better or worse than that of incandescents?
Which type of light bulbs is considered most cost effective and robust?
What are some objections to banning incandescent bulbs?

answers.text: higher initial cost of alternatives and lower quality of light of fluorescent lamps

qas.question: What substance in CFL bulbs raises health concerns?
Do CFLs consume more, less, or the same amount of energy as incandescent bulbs?
What type of light consumes much more energy and therefore strongly reduce the environmental impact of power production?
What does CFLS's have that cause people health concerns?
What is regarded as the worst solution in terms of cost effectiveness and robustness?

context: Objections to banning the use of incandescent light bulbs include the <a2_0>higher initial cost of alternatives and lower quality of light of fluorescent lamps<a2_0/>. Some people have concerns about the health effects of fluorescent lamps. However, even though they contain <a3_0><b7_0>mercury<b7_0/><a3_0/>, the environmental performance of <b5_0><b6_0>CFLs<b6_0/><b5_0/> is much <a0_0>better<a0_0/> than that of light bulbs, mostly because they consume <a4_0>much less<a4_0/> energy and therefore strongly reduce the environmental impact of power production. <a1_0><b8_0>LED lamps<b8_0/><a1_0/> are even more efficient, and are free of mercury. They are regarded as the best solution in terms of cost effectiveness and robustness.
